ImageG.blit:
Copy an image from a source rectangle to a destination rectangle, stretching or
compressing to fit the dimensions of the destination rectangle, if necessary.
ImageG.blitRow: Scale and copy a row of pixels from a texture.
ImageG.clone: Return a copy of the current image
ImageG.copyFrom:
Sets all pixels in the current image from the other image, which has to be of the same size and
bpp.
ImageG.doubled: Stretches the image in both directions by 100%
ImageG.drawIcon: Draw an icon (monochromatic image) using given color
ImageG.drawImage: Draw given image on the current image
ImageG.drawTransparentImage: Draw given image with transparent background on the current image
ImageG.equals:
Returns true if the provided image is the same as this image,
otherwise returns false.
ImageG.fill: Fill entire image with a given color
ImageG.flipX: Flips (mirrors) pixels horizontally in the current image
ImageG.flipY: Flips (mirrors) pixels vertically in the current image
ImageG.getRows: Copy row(s) of pixel from image to buffer (8 bit per pixel).
ImageG.height: Get the height of the image
ImageG.isMono: True if the image is monochromatic (black and white)
ImageG.overlapsWith: Check if the current image "collides" with another
ImageG.replace: Replaces one color in an image with another
ImageG.rotated: Returns an image rotated by -90, 0, 90, 180, 270 deg clockwise
ImageG.scroll: Every pixel in image is moved by (dx,dy)
ImageG.setRows: Copy row(s) of pixel from buffer to image.
ImageG.transposed: Returns a transposed image (with X/Y swapped)
ImageG.width: Get the width of the image
helpers.imageRotated: Returns an image rotated by 90, 180, 270 deg clockwise
image.doubledIcon: Double the size of an icon
image.ofBuffer: Create new image with given content
images:
Creation, manipulation and display of LED images.

Image manipulation blocks
